dialogues.text: OkayВ— I guess they got enough exercise. Let 'em come in. He puts down the pole and the birds start flying down tow He sees Edie approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder how long she's goin' to hang around, huh, Terry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the pigeons)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be sure they got enough water. And he turns to await Edie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed my mind. I feel real mean tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. So do I. As Jimmy goes off to fetch some water, Edie reads the fan on the back of his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Golden Warriors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started them Golden Warriors. I was their first Supreme Commander. Now Jimmy starts back toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My shadow. He follows me around like I was Mickey Mantle. Thinks I'm a big man because I boxed pro for a while. (throws a few quick jabs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several pigeons swoop down and enter the coop. He nods to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they come! The champion flock of the neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mind yourself at all, do you. (turns to the birds)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey used to race pigeons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (darkening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a few birds. (pauses, nods toward Joey's coop across the roof)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got up and fed 'em this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was nice of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disconcerted, needing to talk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like pigeons. You send a bird five hundred miles  away he won't stop for food or water until he's back  in his own coop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have thought you'd be so interested В—in pigeons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go for this stuff. You know this city's full of hawks? There must be twenty thousand of 'em. They perch on top of the big hotels and swoop down on the pigeons in the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The things that go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly indicating a large pigeon in the coop)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like that one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh she's a beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (critically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a he. His name is Swifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lead bird. He's always on that top perch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks awful proud of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why shouldn't he? He's the boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If another fella tries to take that perch away from him, he lets him have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even pigeons aren't peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing about them though, they're faithful. They get married just like people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, once they're mated they stay together all their lives until one of 'em dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. They look at each other, both strangely upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you like beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to go out and have one with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a saloon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (imploring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I know a quiet one, with a special entrance for ladies... .

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Perhaps a sign can emphasize Ladies' Entrance. As Terry l a tipsy Irish biddy is noisily protesting her enforced de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—I'm only after havin' one more wee bitВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and your one-mores. Now beat it. As Terry and Edie reach the bar, the radio blares a baseb roar goes up from the speaker. Bartender nods to Terry. I small well-oiled longshoreman sings "I'll Take You Home A Kathleen" in a plaintive, cracking voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do you knowВ—Jackie just stole home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at Edie with a mischievous wink at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bartender) I wouldn't mind doing that myself. The bartender grins. Terry guides Edie to a small table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Edie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you drinking? Edie hesitates, obviously not knowing what to ask for. A the bar says, loudlyВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a Glockenheimer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (it could be root beer for all she knows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try aВ— Glockenheimer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to bartender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likewise. And draw two for chasers. (to Edie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're beginning to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as the drinks are poured)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am? Edie picks up her glass, sniffs the contents with some di then sips it tentatively. Terry watches with amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still swaggering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that wayВ— like this. (holds glass up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the hatch! (gulps it down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wham! Edie takes her drink and does likewise. She gasps and her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with soft amazement)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wham... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiteВ— (gulps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В–nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about another one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (already feeling this one)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to bartender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit me again, Mac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he pours drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See the fight last night? That RileyВ—both hands. Little bit on your style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope he has better luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you really a prize fighter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went pretty good for a while, didn't I, Al? ButВ— I didn't stay in shapeВ— andВ— (a little ashamed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—I had to take a few dives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dive? You mean, into the water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs harshly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, in the ring, a dive is- He stops, shakes his head and with his finger draws an in in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mystified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Describing you. A square from out there. I mean you're nowhere. (draws it again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Four Corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, but persistent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What made you want to be a fighter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to scrap all my life. Figured I might as well get paid for it. When I was a kid my old man got killedВ—never mind how. Charley and I was put in a placeВ—they called it a Children's Home. Some home! I run away and peddled papers, fought in club smokers andВ— (catches himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what am I runnin' off at the mouth for? What do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we care about everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a fruitcake you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't everybody part of everybody else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, thoughts! Alla time thoughts! (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really believe that drool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to hear my philosophy? Do it to him before he does it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aroused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Lord said just the opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not lookin' to get crucified. I'm lookin' to stay in one piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flaring up) I never met such a person. Not a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spark of romance or sentiment orВ— or human kindness in your whole body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they do for you, except get in your way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when things get in your wayВ— or people В—you just knock them asideВ— get rid of ThemВ— is that your idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensiveВ— stung)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ListenВ— get this straightВ— don't look at me when you say them things. It wasn't my fault what happened to your brother. Fixing Joey wasn't my idea... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Terry, who said it was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lamely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, nobody, I guess. But that Father Barry, I didn't like the way he kept lookin' at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was looking at everybody the same way. Asking the same question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (troubled, not convinced)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah... . (suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Father Barry, what's his racket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HisВ— racket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to regain his bravado)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been off in daisyland, honey. Everybody's got a racket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a priest...? With his finger he again describes a square in the air an through it to Edie. This time it angers her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe in anything, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie, down here it's every man for himself. It's keepin' alive! It's standin' in with the right people so you can keep a little loose change jinglin' in your pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't (points downward with a descending whistle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your neck in and your nose clean and You'll never have no trouble down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's living like an animalВ— Terry seems almost to illustrate this by the way he drain and wipes his mouth with his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather live like an animal than end up likeВ— He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Joey? Are you afraid to mention his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (challengedВ—defensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why keep harpin' on it? (looks at her unfinished beer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, drink up. You got to get a little fun out of life. What's the matter with you? (nods toward juke box)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll play you some music. He starts toward the juke box. She turns with him. Sudden cries out in her, almost as if she didn't know she was go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, if you canВ— for God's sakes help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time the edge is knocked off his swagger. H purity of her grief. He'd like to helpВ—that's his immedi But there's his brother Charley and his steady work and h to the mob and its code. All this runs through his mind, tearing him... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry turns back to her, with a helpless gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ— I'd like to, Edie, butВ— (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—there's nothin' I can do. Edie feels subdued, ashamed at breaking down. She rises,  and in a low  voice saysВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right.. I shouldn't 've asked you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't finished your beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want it. But why don't you stay and finish your drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swinging off the stool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my whole life to drink. As if magnetized by her, he follows her out.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: As Terry comes up alongside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not sore at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with complete innocence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ForВ— not being any help? She looks at him with disturbing simplicity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why noВ— I think you would if you could... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struck. Her faith in him and in human nature becomes the kind of accusation.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-SHOT
dialogues.text: Softly, silently, she begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you crying for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I felt mean tonight. But I'm notВ— I'm justВ— all mixed up... . Ahead of them down the block is an outdoor neighborhood p rhythm of a small band reaches out to them. Edie hangs ba takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I'll walk you through. It's the shortest way home. He takes her hand and she walks along with him passively. illuminated with colored lights and bright paper streamer several gaily decorated counters serving drinks and sandw are balloons and colored paper hats. Neighbors are dancin street. Children look on, a few mimicking their elders f sidelines. Above the street is a homemade banner inscribe MARRIEDВ— JOHNNY AND MARY O'DAY! We catch a glimpse of th bridal couple, as Terry and Edie reach the edge of the ce eyes light up. She has passed into a dreamlike forgetfuln

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like music? Edie nods dreamily. В—and dancing? Edie nods again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling her to him before she realizes what has

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: happened) We're on! At first Edie dances somewhat clumsily and stiffly but gr to dance with zest and surprising skill, as if a whole su of her nature were suddenly being released. Terry is ligh and they do some intricate steps together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, we're good!  (grins at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sisters should see you now, huh? She laughs, out of her youth and embarrassment and unexpe of a stolen moment. Now Terry draws her to him and they dance a more conventi foxtrot to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkwardly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ— I never knew a girl like you, Edie. I always knew the kind you just grab 'em AndВ— I never knew a girl like you, Edie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fun dancing with your eyes closed. I'm floating. I'm floating... . They have danced off to a darker, less populated section away from the bar and the bandstand. Behind them people a laughing. Terry's lips brush her cheek as they dance, and her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathlessly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie... . Carried away, she allows him to kiss her and even respond feels someone tapping him on the shoulder.  He wheels aro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barney wears a colored paper hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been looking for you, Terry. The boss wants you.

dialogues.speaker: THREE-SHOT
dialogues.text: While the music and dancing continue around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just got a call from "Mr. Upstairs." Something's gone wrong. He's plenty hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna take her home first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd get over there, Terry. I'll take the little lady home

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for Edie's benefit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come over when I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Johnny when he gets mad. As suddenly as Barney arrived, he ducks off .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie senses Terry's distraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that? She is about to move away; Terry puts his hand on her arm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impulsively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie, listen, stay out of this mess. Quit tryin' to ask things about Joey. It ain't safe for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why worry about me? You're the one who says only look out for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pent up with his guilt and his frustrated feeling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: for her) Okay, get in hot water. But don't come hollerin' to me when you get burned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I come hollering to you at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... because... (apologetically, as if this were a sign of weakness)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Edie, don't get sore nowВ— but I think we're getting in love with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really fighting against it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let myself fall in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fervently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That goes double for me. As they stare at each other in entangled hostility and lo turns from the food counter behind them, just finishing a steps into Terry's path. It is Mr. Glover, the Commission In the B.G. is Gillette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Malloy, I was hoping I might find you here. Terry turns as if to dart off. Glover puts a restraining arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're being served with a subpoena, Mr. Malloy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching quickly into his briefcase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be at the State House, Courtroom Nine, at ten o'clock tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I don't know nothin' and I ain't saying nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can bring a lawyer if you wish. And you're privileged under the Constitution to protect yourself against  questions that might implicate you in any crimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more in pain than anger now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what you're askin'? You're askin'В—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping in from B.G.) (sternly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Malloy, all we're asking you to do is tell the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, kid. Terry looks at the subpoena in tortured confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (viciously reverting to type)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't eat cheese for no cops, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with sudden intuition)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Johnny Friendly who killed Joey, wasn't it? Terry looks off and then looks down, unable to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had him killed or had something to do with it, Didn't he? He and your brother Charley? Terry drops his eyes again; he can say nothing. You can't tell me, can you? Because you're a part of it. You're as bad as the worst of them, aren't you, Terry? Aren't you? Tell me the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie, your old man's right, go back to that school out in daisyland. You're driving yourself nutsВ— you're driving me nutsВ— stop worrying about the truthВ— worry about yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out for number one. Always number one. (her voice rising in anger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should've known you wouldn't tell me. Pop said Johnny Friendly used to own you. I think he still owns you. (then gently, and hating to have to say it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder everybody calls you a bum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if struck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that, Edie, don't... Edie is crying softly, without sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a half-sob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tryin' to keep you from being hurtВ— What more do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much more, Terry. Much, much more! She runs off. Terry looks after her, pained; the subpoena hand. He stares at it in agony, while the party swirls ar the blare of an auto horn cuts through the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, genius. Terry looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Friendly's black Cadillac parked across the street Sonny, Truck, Big Mac, and Charley are in it. Terry hurri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lamely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ— I was just on my way up, Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By way of Chicago? Sonny starts to laugh but Johnny cuts him short . How many times you been knocked out, Terry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only two times, why, Johnny? Throughout the following tirade, Charley would like to in Terry's behalf, but Johnny roughly nudges him into silenc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must have been once too often. I think your brains come apart. What you got up there, Chinese bells?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Johnny... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were gonna keep an eye on that church meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened, Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened, he says. Some operator you got yourself there, Charley. One more like him and we'll all be wearing striped pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Charley for help)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a big nothing! The Father did all the talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he did. Half an hour later a certain Timothy J. Nolan went into secret session with the Commission and he did all the talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Kayo Nolan, the old timer? He doesn't know much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He don't, huh? (produces a bound folder of testimony

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from his pocket and slams it on the fender) Well, he knows thirty-nine pages worth of our operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thumbing 'upstairs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. Hot off the press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The complete works of Timothy J. Nolan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nolan? I knew he had guts butВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guts! A crummy pigeon who's looking to get his neck wrung! (to Charley) You should have (to Charley)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have known better than to trust this  punched out brother of yours.  He was all right hanging around for laughs. But this is business. I don't like goofoffs messing in our business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now just a minute, IВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing with his sister? (then turning to Johnny)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that girl, Johnny, the little Doyle broad has him ou on his feet. An unhealthy relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't see her no more. Unless you're both tired of living. Barney, you got her address? (then to others, businesslike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen, if we don't muzzle Nolan, we're into the biggest stink this town ever seen. We got the best muscle on the waterfront. The time to use it is nowВ— prontoВ— if not sooner. (to Terry, as he climbs in the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you know where you're going? Back in the holdВ— no more cushy job in the loft. It's down the hold with the sweat gang till you learn your lesson. Johnny twists Terry's cheek, but not in fun this time, as done before. Now it is hard enough to draw blood. Then he driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! The car drives off fast, almost running Terry down. He st looking after it, alone in the street, feeling his wounde then scowling as he looks down at the subpoena in his han

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The ship is being unloaded. An empty pallet is swung from lowered into the open hatch by the up-and-down-fall tackl rides the pallet down into the hatch, to the second level is working. A little removed from him are Pop, Moose and are unloading Irish whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifting a case onto the pallet joyously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Ir-rish ship loaded to the gunnels with foine Ir-rish whiskey! He does a little jig and kisses the case as he sets it on Pop and Moose laugh. But Terry looks over at Nolan tensel looks up out of the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Johnny Friendly comes up to the edge of the dock with Son Johnny mumbles something under his hand to Sonny and Sonn jumps down onto the deck of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonny motions to Specs Donahue, glimpsed as Joey's killer opening. Specs nods and goes over to the winchman guiding over the hatch. He nods to him, and takes his place. Then the eye ofВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing on the deck just above the open hatch. A wordles passes between him and Specs. Then he looks down into the

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Terry works grimly, glancing up anxiously at Nolan, Pop a mood, in contrast, is a whiskey-inspired euphoria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, Kayo, the good Lord watches over us after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in an undertone, gaily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we knock off let's have a bit of a party. We'll drink to God and Ireland, its whiskey and its women to Joey and EdieВ—  and death to tyrants everywhere... .! As he finishes this he reveals surreptitiously the neck o bottle concealed in his deep-pocketed jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with mock concern)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think one bottle's enough for all them toasts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick, me lad, I'm ahead of you. With a wink he reaches into his other pocket and draws up another bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid one bottle might get lonely by itself. (reaching into still another pocket and revealing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: still more bottles) Now you see the advantage of a little man in a big coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely! Nolan, my boy, you're a walkin' distillery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder how many Hail Marys the Father'll make me say at confession. (reflects)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be worth it! The pallet is loaded now. Terry turns and approaches Nola

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a nervous glance upward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ListenВ— NolanВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backing away suspiciously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you down here forВ— to see we don't make off with any of Mister Friendly's precious cargo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (miserably)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nolan... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down into the hatch. Above him we can see Specs a controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Kayo, get it up!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Nolan and Pop look up at him and then back to their work mischievous resentment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing to bellow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't be walking off with any of that. You know how the boss feels about individual pilferage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pretending to clean out his ears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk louder. I can't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you kept your ears wide open instead of your mouthВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I talk too loud it's the fault of the nuns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what in blazes have the nuns got to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowers his voice and confides in the hatch gang)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a mere spit of a lad on Ferry Street in Dublin the nuns used to say to me, "Nolan, don't be swallowin' ye words like fishballs. When you got something to sayВ— (Now he shouts up at Big Mac.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—Talk with your mouth wide open," so if I'm loud don't blame meВ— it's the fault of the nuns! Pop laughs, at Big Mac's expense. The laughter is infecti the hatch. Moose lets go with his loud "haw haw." Everyon except Terry, who watches in a cold sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furiously, from above)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, knock it off! The men laugh even louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haw hawВ— that's a good one, Kayo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (able to shout above their laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off! Stand clear. (to Specs, the winchman, above the hatch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, take it away. Big Mac looks at Specs, touches his cap in a signaling ge nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches the signal. From below the laughter of the men O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full of whiskey cases, from angle of Kayo Nolan, Pop, Ter others, watching it rise out of the hatch. The general la continues. Terry is stiff with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he appears to lose control of the winch, guiding down fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the middle of the hatch, looking up, as the c begins to plunge downward. The general laughter stops. Fr back in the hold Terry cries:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nolan...! And tries to pull him back out of danger. Too late. The o cargo net crashes down on Nolan. Wood splintersВ—glass sh whiskey sprays. Kayo Nolan is pinned under the broken pil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard, flat tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doctorВ— he needs a priest

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands over the body of Kayo Nolan, which lies on the been covered by a tarpaulin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop, Moose, Luke and the others stand near him. On the de hold some seventy-five longshoremen have gathered, includ Others look down from the dock and the loft. Terry is in position we left him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aroused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came down here to keep a promise. I gave Kayo my word that if he stood up to the mob I'd stand up with him all the way. Now Kayo Nolan is dead. He was one of those fellows who had the gift of getting up. But this time they fixed him goodВ— unless it was an accident like Big Mac says. Pop, Moose, and some of the others glare at Big Mac, who tobacco sullenly. Some of the others snicker "accident."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people think the Crucifixion only took place on Calvary. They better wise up. Taking Joey Doyle's life to stop him from testifying is a crucifixionВ— Dropping a sling on Kayo Nolan because he was ready to spill his guts tomorrowВ— that's a crucifixion. Every time the mob puts the crusher on a good manВ— tries to stop him from doing his duty as a citizenВ— it's a crucifixion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voice of Father Barry continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And anybody who sits around and lets it happen, keeps silent about something he knows has happenedВ— shares the guilt of it just as much as the Roman soldier who pierced the flesh of Our Lord to see if He was dead.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT OF EDIE
dialogues.text: Listening, moved. Terry has come up behind her and stands notices him but barely reacts. He listens intently to the Father' (NOTE: I am not indicating in detail the other necessary those of Pop, Moose, the Negro Luke, the watchful hostili and Truck, the murderous arrogance of Johnny Friendly, an sophisticated cynicism of Charley Malloy. But most important of all is the impression being made on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to your church, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up at Truck and pointing to the ship)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, this is my church. If you don't think Christ is here on the waterfront, you got another guess coming. And who do you think He lines up withВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off the dock, Father. Sonny reaches for a box of rotten bananas on the dock and down into the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The banana splatters him, but he ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SONNY
dialogues.text: Terry turns to him. Edie notices this and watches with ap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do that again and I'll flatten you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing. Joining themВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny ain't going to like that, Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him finish. Edie looks at him amazed. Terry catches her eye, and then embarrassed at his good deed. They both turn to watch Fat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near Johnny, watching Terry and then looking at Johnny ap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every morning when the hiring boss blows his whistle, Jesus stands alongside you in the shape-up. More missiles fly, some hitting the Father, but he contin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees why some of you get picked and some of you get passed over. He sees the family men worrying about getting their rent and getting food in the house for the wife and kids. He sees them selling their souls to the mob for a day's pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nodding to Barney. Barney picks up an empty beer can and into the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: It strikes Father Barry and blood etches his forehead. Po forward and shakes his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Christ, the next bum who throws something deals with me. I don't care if he's twice my size. Some of the other longshoremen grumble approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does Christ think of the easy-money boys who do none of the work and take all of the gravy? What does He think of these fellows wearing hundred-and-fifty-dollar suits and diamond ringsВ— on your union dues and your kickback money? How does He feel about bloodsuckers picking up a longshoreman's work tab and grabbing twenty percent interest at the end of a week? CLOSEВ—ON J.P.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind about that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scowling.  Terry, nearby, is increasingly moved by the Fa challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does He, who spoke up without fear against evil, feel about your silence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up about that! He reaches for another rotten banana and is poised to thr simultaneously, Terry throws a short hard right that flat neatly. Edie is watching, a deeply felt gratitude in her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little way off .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that? Johnny presses his lips together but makes no sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves closer to him. He barely glances at her, then c listening to Father Barry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know what's wrong with our waterfront? It's love of a lousy buck. It's making love of a buckВ— the cushy jobВ— more important than the love of man. It's forgetting that every fellow down here is your brother in Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Father Barry's voice rises to a climaxВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But remember, fellows, Christ is always with youВ— Christ is in the shape-up, He's in the hatchВ— He's in the union hallВ— He's kneeling here beside NolanГ‘and He's saying with all of youВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you do it to the least of mine, you do it to me! What they did to Joey, what they did to Nolan, they're doing to you. And you. And YOU. And only you, with God's help, have the power to knock 'em off for good! (turns to Nolan's corpse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Kayo? (then looks up and says, harshly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. He makes the sign of the cross. Pop, Moose, Tommy, Luke, do likewise.  Big Mac and Specs, seeing the others, reluc suit. Then, disgruntled, Big Mac climbs up out of the hat bellows:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, fellowsВ— break it up! Let's go! Strongly moved, the longshoremen glare at Big Mac and the start back to their places on the deck, in the hatches, o etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pallet rises out of the hatch with the body on it. Po casually on the edge with Father Barry who, in pantomime, cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie crosses herself. Then she looks at Terry. They look and the feeling in both of them is some terrible hunger beyond their cont moment it seems as if Terry must go to her, but instead h slowly, as if this were the most diffi cult thing he was do. Edie looks after him and we feel that she will yield call out to him.  But she looks down instead, finally, an eyes, imperceptibly trembling against desire.  Luke comes but she is lost in her own most private thoughts and does see him. He carries Joey's jacket, the one Nolan has been

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie... . (nudges her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EdieВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OhВ— Luke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's jacket. I thought maybe Kayo'd like you to have it back. Edie looks at him, and takes it silently. She hugs it to "Thank you," and, in a kind of sleepwalking, starts towar of the pier. Luke watches her anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you're okay? She nods and continues on alone.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: At the pigeon coop near Terry's rooftop window. Under the mattress he uses as outdoor sleeping quarters on hot summ Terry is staring in at the pigeons, full of his own troub bestirring thoughts. Edie comes up behind him almost sile the jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding the coat out to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ— I brought this for you, Terry. It was Joey's. (her conscious self trying to conceal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3t4the real meaning) Yours is coming out at the elbows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (close to herВ— and not really caring what he is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: saying) I don't rate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, wear it. From the pigeon coop comes the soft sound of pigeons cooi upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pigeons... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hawk around. They're scared tonight. She looks up and huddles a little closer to him. Now he r herВ—groping with an unfamiliar inexorable emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EdieВ— IВ— IВ— never said this to a girl before, I never knew a girl worth trying to say it for, but youВ— you're... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering and suddenly wiser than he)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... I know... . He kisses her at last, with pent-up violence and hunger. deep-throated ship's whistle rolls across the river but t hear it. There is a tremendous sense of release and relie mouths and bodies press together.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Terry waits in anguish for the shutter of the confessiona When it does, Father Barry is glimpsed from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blurting it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, help me, I've got blood on my hands. Father Barry looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bless me, Father, for I haveВ— To Terry's amazement the shutter closes abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: As Father Barry steps out of the booth, Terry hurries fro the booth and clasps Father Barry's arms violently. Fathe on walking and Terry follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter? I've got something That's chokin' me. I've gotta get it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else c'n take your confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're the one I want to tellВ— what you said over NolanВ— about keepin' silent when you know the scoreВ— I'm guiltyВ— you hear me? I'm guilty... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to move on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hear it in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rapidly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell it to me in there and my lips are sealed. But if I dig it out myself I can use it where it'll do the most good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you've got to listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find you a priest. Father Barry starts off again. Terry follows him desperat terrible compulsion to bare himself to Father Barry. He g Father by the arm fiercely, half spinning him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with relief, as he gets it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, it was me who set Joey Doyle up for the muggers. Father Barry stops and stares at him, realizing Terry is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come take a walk with me, kid, and give it to me straight. There's nothing I haven't heard. They turn toward the exit of the church.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: They enter the park, on rise overlooking the docks, Terry him eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouring it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—It started as a favorВ— for my brotherВ— you know they'd ask me things and it's hard to say noВ— a favorВ— Who am I kiddin'? They call it a favor but it's do it or else. And this time the favor turned out to be helping them knock off Joey. I just thought they'd lean on him a little butВ— Last night with Edie I wanted to tell her only itВ— stuck in my throat. I guess I was scared of drivin' her awayВ— and I love her, Father. She's the first thing I ever loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost brusquely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Edie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie. The Commission. Your subpoena. I know you got a subpoena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like carrying a monkey around on your back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A question of who rides who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I spill, my life won't be worth a nickel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is your soul worth if you don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's my own brother they're askin' me to fingerВ— and Johnny Friendly. His mother and my mother was first cousins. When I was this high he took me to the ball games... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (violently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ball games! Don't break my heart! I wouldn't care if he gave you a life pass to the Polo Grounds. So you got a brother. Well, let me tell you something you got some other brothersВ— and they're all getting the short end while your cousin Johnny gets mustard on his face at the Polo Grounds. If I was youВ— (He catches himself and drops his voice.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В— Listen, I'm not asking you to do anything,  Terry. It's your own conscience that's got  to do the asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conscience... . (shakes his head ruefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't even know I had one until I met you and Edie... this conscience stuff can drive you nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waiting for someone to do it for him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all you've got to say to me, Father? Father Barry looks off .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie coming toward them in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's up to you. Just one more thing. You better tell Edie Terry turns in Edie's direction, reluctantly. He goes off Father Barry stands looking after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie... Edie... ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been sittin' in the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost inarticulate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, it's up to me, it's up to meВ— he says it's up to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Father. The Father. He is trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TerryВ— what's happening to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just told the Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told him what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I did to Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I did to Joey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell meВ— don't tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (plunging in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EdieВ— it'sВ— What he starts to say is drowned out by an immense, prolo the whistle from the departing ocean liner. Terry shouts to Edie compulsively but we cannot hear it over the raspi the whistle. Edie is horrified as she catches enough word what Terry is trying to say. The whistle pauses a moment, just enough to hear Terry shoutВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't knowВ— Then the blast of the boat whistle drowns him out again. finally stops, Terry is finishingВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—but don't you see, Edie, I never thought they'dВ— (then hysterically as he feels her turning away from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: him) I don't know what to do, Edie, I don't know what to do! I swear to God IВ— She looks at him, turns and strides off .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling, desperately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie... Edie... What'll I do, Edie, what'll I do? She doesn't look back. Terry watches her go, with mountin then he lurches on in drunken confusion.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: As Terry, still dazed, enters onto the roof, Jimmy Conner Golden Warrior blazer, is exercising the pigeons. He sees Terry and runs up to h talks in a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Terry, guess who's here... that joker from the Commission... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got his nerve, gum-shoeing around here after what you told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs Jimmy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, suppose I knew something, say a mug somebody put on somebody... . (violent gesture illustrates what he means)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I should turn him in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cheese-eater!  You're kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm kidding, I'm kidding. You don't think I should turn him in... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gives him a look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You was a Golden Warrior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YeahВ— us Golden Warriors. (grabs Jimmy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good kid, Jimmy, a good tough kid. We stick together, huh, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You was our first Supreme Commander, Terry. Keep out of sight and I'll tell him you're out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I ain't out. I'm in. I'm in. Who's lying to who?

dialogues.speaker: ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: Terry walks over to where Glover is sitting, rubbing his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You looking for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly. Just thought I'd sit down and rest my dogs a minute. (smiles and rubs his ankle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the next investigation we get into I hope it's got buildings with elevators in them. This one has been nothing but climbing stairs. And when we hit the top Гџoor the folks are usually out. Jimmy gestures behind him as if to say "Get a load of thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distractedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it's pretty tough work at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it'll be worth it if we can tell the waterfront story the way the people have a right to hear it. Don't you think? Terry shrugs. Glover studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I see you fight in the Garden one night three or four years ago? With a fellow called Wilson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still preoccupied)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WilsonВ— yeahВ—  yeahВ— I fought Wilson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to take him that night but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this is the key that unlocks him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know somethingВ— I would have taken WilsonВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you could have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I licked him I would have had the title shot instead of himВ— boy, I was ready that night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure looked it. Something go wrong? Terry has been growing more and more animated but now he sullen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Johnny Friendly and my brother had other ideas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspiciously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, this ain't for publication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just resting my feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the first round how I had him against the ropes, andВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never forget it. I thought it was all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. My own bloodВ— and they sell me out for a lousy betВ— I had it in me to hit the top andВ— (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, if I wanted to, the things I could tell you about them guysВ— (then catches himself and pauses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (expectantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Terry is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rises)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I better get going. Hit those stairs again. (turns casually)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that a looping right or an uppercut the first time you caught him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insulted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looping right! I never swung wild. I was strictly a short puncherВ— hooksВ— over 'n underВ— (pantomimes, with violent short breath-releases)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В— whop-whop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, really! As Glover reaches the door, Terry keeps following him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going? I'll walk along with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins warmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure... . Terry follows Glover out, continuing to pantomime punches after them and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Back room. It is set up as an informal kangaroo court . J pointing at Charley Malloy, who is on the hot seat. Johnny Friendly is the judge, flanked by Truck, Sonny, Barney, Specs, J.P. Morgan and others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't hear them, boss, but I sure seen them, walking along and smiling like a pair of lovers. Charley looks uncomfortable. He hasn't finished his drink

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching him carefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink up, Charley. We're ahead of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disturbed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After what we been hearing about your brother, I thought your throat'd be kind of dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they're walking along and smiling. That doesn't mean he's going to talk. There's no evidence until he gives public testimony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the legal advice, Charley. That's what we always kept you around for. (smiles wisely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now how do we keep him from giving this testimony? Isn't that theВ— erВ— as you put itВ— main order of business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was always a good kid. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'sa bum. After all the days I give him in the loftВ— he got no gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offended)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Mac, I'm conducting thisВ— (nodding to Charley)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This girl and the Father got their hooks in him so deep he doesn't know which end is up anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't interested in his mental condition. All I want to know is, is he D 'n D or is he a canary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I, Charley. For your sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do, Johnny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very simple. Just bring him to... that place we been using. Mac, you take care of the details. Call Gerry G. in if you think you need him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerry G!! You don't want to do that, Johnny! Sure the boy's outa line, but he's just a confused kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused kid? First he crosses me in public and gets away with it and then the next joker, and pretty soon I'm just another fellow down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny, I can't do that. I can't do that, Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my own kid broВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for you to figure out. You can have it your way or you can have it his way. (gestures with his palms up and his palms down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't have it both ways. (turns to Sonny)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I right, Sonny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thumbing Charley to his feet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, on your horse, you deep thinker. Charley rises reluctantly, his confident, springy manner

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Charley and Terry have just entered the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, Charley, I'm sure glad you stopped by for me. I needed to talk to you. What's it they say about blood, it'sВ— (falters)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking away coldly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thicker than water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gravel voice, without turning around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four thirty-seven River Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: River Street? I thought we was going to the Garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to cover a bet there on the way over. Anyway, it gives us a chance to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (good-naturedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing ever stops you from talking, Charley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grapevine says you picked up a subpoena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Noncommittal, Sullen.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching for his reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, the boys know you too well to mark you down for a cheese-eater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MmВ—hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, the boys are getting rather interested in your future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MmВ—hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They feel you've been sort of left out of things, Terry. They think it's time you had a few little things going for you on the docks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steady job and a few bucks extra, that's all I wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, that's all right when you're a kid, but you'll be pushing thirty pretty soon, slugger. It's time you got some ambition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always figured I'd live longer without it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Terry looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a slot for a boss loader on the new pier we're opening up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss loader!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten cents a hundred pounds on everything that moves in and out. And you don't have to lift a finger. It'll be three-four hundred a week just for openers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for all that dough I don't do nothin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely nothing. You do nothing and you say nothing. You understand, don't you, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling with an unfamiliar problem of conscience and loyalties)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YeahВ— yeahВ— I guess I doВ— but there's a lot more to this whole thing than I thought, Charley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mean you're thinking of testifying againstВ— (turns a thumb in toward himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't knowВ— I don't know! I tell you I ain't made up my mind yet. That's what I wanted to talk to you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patiently, as to a stubborn child)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Terry, these piers we handle through the localsВ— you know what they're worth to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then, you know Cousin Johnny isn't going to jeopardize a setup like that for one rubber-lippedВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—ex-tanker who's walking on his heelsВ— ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have been better!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point isВ— there isn't much time, kid. There is a painful pause, as they appraise each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you, Charley, I haven't made up my mind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make up your mind, kid, I beg you, before we get to four thirty-seven River... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four thirty-sevenВ— that isn't where Gerry G...? Charley nods solemnly. Terry grows more agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley... you wouldn't take me to Gerry G... .? Charley continues looking at him. He does not deny it. Th each other for a moment. Then suddenly Terry starts out o Charley pulls a pistol. Terry is motionless, now, looking at Charley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the boss loading, kid. For God's sake. I don't want to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed, gently guiding the gun down toward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley's lap) Charley... . Charley... . Wow... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I didn't have to do this, Terry. Terry eyes him, beaten. Charley leans back and looks at T strangely. Terry raises his hands above his head, somewha manner of a prizefighter mitting the crowd. The image nic memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an accusing sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you weigh these days, slugger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...eight-seven, eighty-eight. What's it to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nostalgically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, when you tipped one seventy-five you were beautiful. You should've been another Billy Conn. That skunk I got to manage you brought you along too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't him! (years of abuse crying out in him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you, Charley. You and Johnny. Like the night the two of youse come in the dressing room and says, "Kid, this ain't your nightВ— we're going for the price on Wilson." It ain't my night. I'd of taken Wilson apart that night! I was readyВ— remember the early rounds throwing them combinations. So what happensВ— This bum Wilson he gets the title shotВ— outdoors in the ballpark! В– and what do I getВ— a couple of bucks and a one-way ticket to Palookaville. (more and more aroused as he relives it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you, Charley. You was my brother. You should of looked out for me. Instead of making me take them dives for the short-end money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always had a bet down for you. You saw some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agonized)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See! You don't understand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to keep you in good with Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand! I could've been a contender. I could've had class and been somebody. Real class. Instead of a bum, let's face it, which is what I am. It was you, Charley. Charley takes a long, fond look at Terry.  Then he glance the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Charley's angle. A gloomy light reflects the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you, Charley... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back to Terry, his tone suddenly changed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OkayВ— I'll tell him I couldn't bring you in. Ten to one they won't believe it, butВ— go ahead, blow. Jump out, quick, and keep going... and God help you from here on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Terry jumps out. A bus is just starting up a little fu the street.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Running, Terry leaps onto the back of the moving bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to driver as he watches Terry go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now take me to the Garden. Charley sinks back in his seat, his hand covering his fac turns around, gives him a withering look, steps on the ga the car intoВ—

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: They have reached a garage, and now the car zooms through We catch a glimpse of Truck, Sonny and Big Mac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny is watching from across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Mac and Sonny pull the big black sliding door shut un itself is blacked out. Inside there is the roaring sound racing.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Edie is in bed. There is a pounding on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Terry, in a wild state after his escape, is pounding on t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie, it's meВ— let me inВ— it's me! He pounds on the door even harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pounding continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Fiercely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop it! Get away from here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to see you. Got to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. I want you to leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: The pounding grows louder. Suddenly there is the sound of being broken open. Edie draws back against the head of he the covers around her. Terry runs in wild-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to, Edie. I had to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky Pop isn't home, he'd kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I stink, don't you? You think I stink for what I told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it. I want you to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie, listen to me! I want you to believe me. I want to be with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wrenching herself free)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be with Charley and Johnny Friendly and still be with me? Either way it's a lie. It's like there were two different people inside of you. You've got to be one or the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hurt CharleyВ— I don't want to hurt you..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you who's being hurt. By keeping it inside you, like a poison. Sooner or later it's got to come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you want me to do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you to do anything. Let your conscience tell you what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pounding his fist on the bed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ— (pound! pound!)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—word again! Why do you keep saying conscience, conscience... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never mentioned the word before. In his agony he grips a glass standing on the night table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep hearing it and I don't know what to do..I don't know what to do... . Without realizing what he is doing, he squeezes the glass powerful fist until it breaks. The glass cuts his hand. H in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a scratch. You won't die. She turns away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie, I need you to love me. Tell me you love me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say I didn't love you. I said stay away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groping for her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie, Edie, I... His arms move around her. Her reaction is convulsive. Her over him in anger and love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me (her face close to his)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from meВ— (closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StayВ— They kiss, lying across the bed, and the fever seizes the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—away from me! Then, after some moments, they are distracted byВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Terry, come on down. I got something to show you,  Terry. Startled, they cling to each other. The voice calls again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Terry, your brother's down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more curious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley's waitin' for ya. Come on down and see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go. Don't go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But CharleyВ— maybe Charley needs me. I better see what he wants. He goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry... She rises and calls toward the doorВ— Terry... Then she runs to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear what I heard? Edie looks up and to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking out another window of the tenement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the same way they called Andy out the night I lost him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrified. Looking for Terry. She runs from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Edie runs out onto it. She looks down wildly, searchin ship's whistle makes a mournful sound. A great luxury lin out to the harbor. Fog is drifting in over the roof. She can see nothing. She hears a wild shriek from the street the railing again. It is only a teenager whooping it up b hears shotsВ—BangВ—BangВ— BangВ—and the sound of a police siren. She raises her han and cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry. Then she hears the follow-up of the police siren. It is o near the open window of the floor below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now for your weekly dramatic thrill straight from the files of the City's FinestВ— Police Patrol... . ("Dragnet"-type music)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie turns away in exasperation. She calls down the fire the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry! There is no answer. Mrs. Collins appears on the fire esca kimono.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go down! Mrs. Collins tries to restrain her but Edie wrenches away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry! She starts to run hysterically down the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: As Edie is coming down the outside metal steps, Mutt is w singing mournfullyВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tippi-tippi-tin, tippi-Tin... . A window opens and an angry voice cries:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop dead! An old shoe is hurled at Mutt, just as Edie turns toward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the angrywindow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spit on me, curse me and stone me, but I suffer for your sins... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go suffer somewhere else, you bum. The window bangs shut. Mutt sees Edie and turns his atten

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seen it. I seen them put him to death! I heard him cry out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatientlyВ— almost hysterically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who. Who did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His executioners. They was stabbing him in his side. And his soft eyes was looking down at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) Tell me who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifting his head from his hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our Lord Jesus. When He died to save us... He gropes toward her as if to paw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with loathing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh get awayВ— get away! She runs on. Mutt goes staggering off in the opposite dir singing his song. Edie runs on until she sees Terry in th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry! She runs into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, I'm frightened. More and more frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Charley. I heard Charley was waiting for me. (calls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley? There is no answer. Terry frowns. Edie points through the

dialogues.speaker: SAME VOICE IN FOG
dialogues.text: Wanna see Charley? He's over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they hurry forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Charley... .

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: The headlights of a car suddenly illuminate Charley again Charley is leaning against the lamp post, in a very casua looking as dapper as usual. Terry and Edie run to him. Th off .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for me, Charley? Charley seems to study them silently. Terry nudges him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
