dialogues.text: Hey Charley. Charley slides down the wall and crumples to the ground. screams. Terry drops beside the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. He's dead. Those scummy, good-for-nuthin' butchers!. The lights of an approaching car catch them in its beam. quickly, cowering against the wall and pulling Edie down protectively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind me. Behind me. It may be them coming back! They huddle in fear as the car comes closer; then it turn lights are no longer on them. Terry lets out a soft whist as the car drives off. Edie is completely panicked now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a horrified whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, let's go away. Terry takes Charley's arm, which is twisted behind him, a it tenderly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it, let's get away from here, first Joey then Nolan, now CharleyВ— and any minute... . (stares at him, almost saying "you")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm frightenedВ— I'm frightened. Terry seems not to hear. There are tears in his eyes but voice as he mutters to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it out of their skulls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to see you killed. I want to live with you. Live with you. Any place it's safe to walk the streets without... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a terrible mutter to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it out of their skulls. He rises, in a dangerous, animal rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, no, no... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hang on to me. And don't follow me. Don't follow me. (turns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the Father. Ask him to take care of Charley for me. brother. There's something I got to do. He looks around, takes note of and strides towardВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little way down the block. An iron grille protects the goes up to the grille and looks in. Edie follows him anxi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are watches, rings, fishing rods, guitars, cameras, instruments, suits, furs, bowler hats, andВ—about two fee windowВ—a .45 revolver in a holster and a belt of cartrid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They put a hole in Charley. I'll put holes in them. Edie sees what Terry is after and tries to restrain him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, go home. There's nothing you can do now. It's locked up. Terry looks at her unseeingly, then drives the toe of his the diamond shaped opening in the grille, and through the it.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Shooting toward Terry, the coveted revolver in the F.G. T cannot quite reach it. He has to press his shoulder painf the jagged glass in order to inch closer to it. He contor pain as the glass cuts through his jacket into his flesh. to dampen his shoulder but with a final effort he gets hi around the gun.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: As Terry draws the gun from the window and slips it into Edie sees the blood dripping from the rip in his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, you're bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a flat tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what I told you. Take care of Charley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, for God's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't let you. I can't, you'reВ— She clings to him sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (violently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hurt you, but... out of my way! He flings her from him and goes on loading the gun, as sh watches him go off .

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: As Terry enters. The usual crowd are present: Barney, Spe Truck, J.P., etc. There is a comedian on TV and everyone but the laughter dies at the sight of Terry. He goes up t tensely. Everyone watches in silence. There is a suggesti feeling for their guns but nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to bartender)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Johnny in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspiciously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? To see for himself, Terry strides through to the back roo open the door. The back room is empty. Then he takes a se so he can watch the room and the entrance. The customers carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jocko)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy now, Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the advice. Give me the whiskey. Jocko sets the drink up. He notices the jagged tear in Te and the spreading stain of blood from the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with your shoulder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (draining his glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in an undertone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, kid, why don't you go home before Johnny... . Terry pushes his empty pony glass forward for another one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No advice. Just whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouring it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy. Easy, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footsteps are heard outside the swinging doors. Terry tur entrance, his hand going to the gun in his pocket. Sonny, Barney, and others all watch him, ready for the draw. Joc automatically crosses himself and turns off the TV, which an irritant. The swinging doors open, but it's not Johnny couple of happy waterf ront barfl ies. But the moment the grins vanish as they are made to feel the tension. They l then they look at the goons watching Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the newcomers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks just the same. The two men bolt out the doorway. In the silence we hear of the ancient swinging doors. The silence is oppressive. his hand over his bleeding shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ought to go home and take care of thatВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching the doorway, growls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things first. Once more steps are heard on the sidewalk outside the bar everyone is on edge for the showdown between Terry and Jo eyes are on the swinging doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father Barry enters, followed by Moose, Tommy, Luke. CAME Father Barry as he walks right up to Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see you, Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got eyes. I'm right in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't give me a hard time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting out his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind your own business, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go and chase yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) Give me that gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (advancing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (just a trifle disconcerted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go toВ— Father Barry throws a good right hand punch that catches surprise and knocks him down. Terry rises, feeling his sh is oozing blood now and weakening him. He  charges Father tormented animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you... . Moose and Luke grab him, although Father Barry waits calm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Terry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get wise to yourself, you bum. The word hits him. Terry drops his hands slowly, weaving from loss of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chastened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your hands off me. What you call me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Terry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bum. Look what you're doing. You want to be brave? Firing lead into another man's flesh isn't brave. Any bum who picks up a .45 in a pawn shop can be that brave. You want to hurt Johnny Friendly? You want to fix him for what he did to CharleyВ— and a dozen men who were better than Charley? Don't fight him like a hoodlum down here in the jungle. That's just what he wants. He'll hit you in the head and plead self-defense. Fight him tomorrow in the courtroomВ— with the truth as you know itВ—  Truth is the gunВ— Drop that thing and tell the truthВ— a more dangerous weapon than this little В— (reaches into Terry's pocket and removes the gun as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he talks) В—cap pistol. The two men look at each other. Father Barry's words cut

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is, if you've got the guts. If you haven't, you better hang on to this. Father Barry offers the gun back to Terry contemptuously. the gun, and holds it self-consciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a beer? (to Jocko)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two beers. Jocko sets them up and Father Barry and Terry drink them at each other. The drink seems to refresh Terry. He turns Jocko and slams the gun down on the bar. Behind the bar is a large picture, in the place of honor, Johnny Friendly arm-in-arm with "Mr. Upstairs," beaming w confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, there is one thing I'd like to do. So saying, he takes his revolver and hurls it into the fa picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeling better)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Johnny I was here. Terry looks around defiantly at the tense gunmenВ—and sta Father Barry and the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching Terry leave. Breathing a sigh of relief as he pi gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inadvertently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... nice boy... . Then he catches the dark looks of Sonny, Truck, Barney, e busies himself at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: A court room door opens. It is the door out of which the brought to testify for hearings of the Waterf ront Crime counsel is just finishing questioning Big Mac...We don't this.  We show Terry walking slowly towards his seat. Edie and F are in the audience. Also Johnny and some of the mob. We dialogue (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean to sit there and tell me that your local takes in sixty-five thousand, five hundred dollars every year and keeps no financial records?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure we keep records!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We was robbed last night and we can't find no books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't it seem odd to you that five different waterfront locals were broken into last night and the only articles removed were financial records?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steadfastly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, odd? We was robbed like I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving him aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all. Next witness! Big Mac steps down, mopping his brow. Terry steps up to t glare at each other as they pass. We CUT to Edie looking from the spectators' section, to Father Barry, Pop, Moose Luke sitting together leaning forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrence Francis Malloy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you swear to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth, so help you God? There is a momentary pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting with Pop, Moose, Luke, and Tommy. Waiting for his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand raised for the oath. When he answers, it seems m mere judicial formality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Malloy, is it true that on the night Joey Doyle was found...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Terry testifying on the TV screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...dead you were the last person to see him before he was pushed off the roof, and that you went immediately to the Friendly Bar where you expressed your feelings about the murder to Mr. Johnny Friendly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. During the above a butler's hand sets a highball glass do rich leather chair, and a strong, manicured hand wearing ring picks up the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will there be anything else, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an impressive, heavy voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sidney, if Mr. Friendly calls, I'm out, and you don't know when I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, sir. The CAMERA moves in on the TV screen, the court room imag when it fi nally stops, we are back toВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .. Thank you, Mr. Malloy, you've done more than to break the case of Joey Doyle, you have held up a lamp of truth in the dark cave of waterfront crime. You may step down now. As Terry steps down, he is quickly surrounded by police b lead him toward the chamber behind the court-room. As he aisle Johnny Friendly leaps up from a long bench facing t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to get at Terry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a walkin' dead man! You're dead on this waterfront and every other waterfront from Boston to New Orleans. You won't go anywhere, drive a truck or a cab or push a baggage rack without one of my guys have the eye on you. You just dug your own grave, dead man, go fall in it! (spits in Terry's face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry leaps at him instinctively. The gavel sounds repeat are cries of "Order! Order!"  Johnny wrestles with Terry, roughly separated by court room guards who lead Terry off toward the door to the private chamber her seat and tries to get to Terry but is kept off by the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Miss, our orders is to keep everybody away. They lead Terry off, as the voice of the clerk is sayingВ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next witness, Mr. Michael J. Skelly, also known as Johnny Friendly... .

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Terry's.

dialogues.speaker: TWO MORE PAIRS OF HEAVY FOOTSTEPS
dialogues.text: Terry's police bodyguards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old men and bums are sitting on the park benches. Loiteri two of Terry's old chums, Chick and Jackie. Terry has to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortably)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ChickВ—  Jackie... They look at him coldly, and turn away. Terry goes on, un police guards just behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half turning, irritably)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have to walk right on top of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orders, Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're stepping on my heelsВ— you're making me nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, you're hot, you know that, you should be glad we're this close to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trailing me like that, you make me feel like a canary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins a little)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now beat itВ— go aheadВ— beat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Terry, take it easy. He looks at his colleague and winksВ—they understand and allowing Terry to continue on down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Edie is preparing coffee on a little stove in the corner enters, drained and let down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you might want some hot coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head moodily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks just the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I feel likeВ— My friends won't talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure they're your friends? Terry looks at her and then paces restlessly. He looks ou

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Jimmy, on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling, halfheartedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, JimmyВ— how's the kid? Jimmy doesn't answer. Terry goes to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jimmy!

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Jimmy Conners, near the pigeon coop. He looks up at Terry doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Terry draws back in defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pigeon for a pigeon... ! Through the open window is flung the body of a dead pigeo Terry's feet. He looks down at it. Its neck has been wrun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brokenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SwiftyВ— my lead birdВ— He looks out toward his coopВ—then climbs out the window toward it. We hold on Edie who watches him, worried, and him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Terry goes to his coop. On the floor are every one of his perhaps three dozen, all with their necks wrung. Terry pi Its head hangs limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to have to grow up too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from deep inside him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pigeons... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, you better stay in for a while. I'll come and cook your meals. Be sure you keep the door locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not seeming to hear her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every one of 'em... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard what Johnny said. No part of the Waterfront'll be safe for you now. Maybe inlandВ— the Middle West somewhereВ— a job on a farm... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters disgustedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farm... He turns and starts back toward his room. She follows des

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it have to be the waterfront! Pop, he's an old man, it's all he knows, but youВ— you could do lots of things, get into something new, anything as long as it's away from Johnny Friendly!

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Terry enters. Edie's voice follows him as she trails behi sits on the bed and looks at the cargo hook hung on a peg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't that make sense! Terry doesn't answer. He takes the cargo hook from the wa viciously into the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you're even listening to me! He pulls the cargo hook out and jabs it into the floor ag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...are you? He looks up at her, frowns and then studies the cargo hoo into his hand with pent-up feeling. The feeling is a stro infectious one. Edie senses it and accuses himВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going down there! He looks up at her again for a moment and then works his handle of the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her voice rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because Johnny warned you not to, you're going down there, aren't you? He doesn't say anything but the determination in him seem constantly mounting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you've got to prove something to them, don't you? That you are not afraid of them andВ— you won't be satisfied until you walk right into their trap, will you? His silence maddens her. She seems on the verge of striki frustration and impotent rage. Her voice is hystericalВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go aheadВ— go ahead! Go down to the shape-up and get yourself killed, you stupid, pigheaded, son of aВ— (struggles to control herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to prove? With a decisive gesture Terry takes the hook and sticks i through his  belt. Then he goes to the wall and lifts Joey's windbreak from the  nail on which it has been hanging. He puts the windbreake on in a  deliberate way, and grins at her as he does so; then he  walks to the  door with a sense of dignity he has never had before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always said I was a bum. WellВ— (points to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—not anymore. I'm going down to the dock. Don't worry, I'm not going to shoot anybody. I'm just going to get my rights. (rubs the sleeve of the jacket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's jacket. It's time I start wearing it. He goes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Big Mac facing the semicircle of several hundred men. Int walks Terry. Other longshoremen instinctively move away from him as he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need fifteen gangs today. Everybody works! He picks men out very quickly and they move forward from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has taken his stand defiantly, with his hands in his p looking Big Mac in the eyes. Big Mac picks men all around He makes it obvious by reaching over Terry's shoulder to behind him.  Finally there are only a handful left around and then they are chosen.  Terry is left standing there a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brazenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still a man short for that last hatch gang, Mac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking at Terry, calls to Sonny)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sonny, go across to the bar and pick up the first man you see. Now Big Mac looks at Terry for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are them cops of yours, stoolie? You're gonna need 'em. He turns away. Terry stands there seething. He looks arou the others ready to enter the pier. They look away, still Big Mac and the power of the mob, and feeling guilty for passivity.

dialogues.speaker: INT
dialogues.text: Johnny looks across at the isolated figure of Terry. Sonn Specs are with Johnny.  On the desk are tabloids with hea reading NAME JOHHNY FRIENDLY AS WATERFRONT MURDER BOSS. U banner head is a large picture of Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ain't a bad picture of you, boss. Johnny glares at him and pushes the paper aside angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd let us go to work on that cheese-eater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with both hands working)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After we get off the front page. Then he's mine. I want him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Sonny returns with "the first man he saw"В—Mutt Murphy. M glance at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your man, Mac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Mac nods Mutt on into the pier, the one armed derelict tu with an apologetic gesture. Terry's fury grows. Mac growl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want more of the same? Come back tomorrow. Terry looks at him, and then across at Johnny's office on His hands begin to tremble. He turns and starts walking slowly, resolutely, down the leading to Johnny's headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seeing Terry through window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's comin' down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gotta be crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing out, growls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, here comes the bum now. I'll top 'im off lovely. Behind Johnny's back the click of a revolver safety latch Johnny whirls on him quickly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offended)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are we gonna protect ourselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever hear of the Sullivan Law? Carrying a gun without a permit? They'll be on us for anything now. The slightest infraction. Give. (turns to the other goons)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of you? GiveВ— giveВ— giveВ— Sonny, Truck and the others reluctantly give up their gun turns to the safe and begins to open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a law-abidin' union. Understand? (As he puts the guns in the safe and slams the safe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: door.) A law-abidin' union!

dialogues.speaker: EXT
dialogues.text: Terry walks compulsively down the ramp to the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Friendly! Johnny Friendly, come out here! Johnny comes out of his office followed by his goons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know the trouble with you? You think it makes you a big man if you can give the answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, JohnnyВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go onВ— beat it. Don't push your luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know somethin'В—?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said beat it! At the right time I'll catch up with you. Be thinkin' about it. As he starts to turn back into his office, Terry advances himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know something? Take the heater away and you're nothin'В— take the good goods away, and the kickback and the shakedown cabbage away and the pistolerosВ— (indicating the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В—away and you're a great big hunk of nothingВ— (takes a deep breath as if relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your guts is all in your wallet and your trigger finger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with fury)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on talkin'. You're talkin' yourself right into the river. Go on, go on... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice rising defiantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad what I done today, see? You give it to Joey, you give it to Nolan, you give it to Charley who was one of your own. You thought you was God Almighty instead of a cheapВ— connivingВ—good-for-nothing bum! So I'm glad what I doneВ— you hear me? В—glad what I done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ratted on us, Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aware of fellow longshoremen watching the duel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From where you stand, maybe. But I'm standing over here now. I was rattin' on myself all them years and didn't know it, helpin' punks like you against people like Pop and Nolan an'... .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beckoning Terry with his hands, in a passion of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hate) Come on. I want you. You're mine. You're mine! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: FIGHT ON UNION OFFICE DECK
dialogues.text: As Johnny takes an aggressive step forward, Terry runs do and hurls himself at him.  They fight furiously on the de houseboat. A fight to the death. A violent brawl with no First one, then the other has the advantage.  In B.G., lo we know creep forward and watchi n amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kid fights like he useta! Others nod but show no inclination to join in and face th

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO FIGHT
dialogues.text: Which mounts in intensity as CAMERA FOLLOWS it around the bordering the union offi ce. Johnny knees Terry but Terry with desperate combinations that begin to beat Johnny to of their faces are bloody and hideously swollen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this point Sonny, Truck and the other goons jump in to leader. Terry fights them off like a mad man, under vicio all angles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll kill 'im!  It's a massacre! etc. But they still hang back, intimidated by Johnny Friendly muscle.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY FIGHTING
dialogues.text: His face a bloody mask, being punched and kicked until he down. Goons are ready to finish the job when a battered J mutters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough. Let 'im lay there. Terry is crumpled on the deck, senseless, in a pool of bl

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Pushing their way anxiously through the crowd of longshor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tight-lipped)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to young longshoreman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fiercely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me by.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO TERRY
dialogues.text: Blood seeping from his many wounds as Father Barry and Ed kneel at his side. Johnny Friendly near by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want 'im? (as he goes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can have 'im. The little rat's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to longshoreman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get some fresh water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry... Terry... . Terry groans, barely conscious.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE TO PIER
dialogues.text: In felt hat and business suit, symbols of executive autho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in charge here? We gotta get this ship going. It's costing us money. The longshoremen hang back, glancing off toward the falle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving them towardhim)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Let's get goin'! The men don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saidВ— c'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Terry? If he don't work, we don't work. Others around him murmur agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from B.G.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work! He can't even walk!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY ON RAMP
dialogues.text: Surrounded by longshoremen ignoring Stevedore's command, them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Get in there! (grabbing Pop and shoving him forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you! From force of habit, Pop begins to comply. Then he catche turns on Johnny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sounding more sad than angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my life you pushed me around. Suddenly he shoves Johnny off the ramp into the water scu slick and riverbank debris.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY IN WATER
dialogues.text: Cursing.

dialogues.speaker: POP AND LONGSHOREMEN
dialogues.text: Cheering Johnny Friendly's humiliation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from water)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, get me outa here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Time is money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hoid 'im. Terry walk in, we walk in with 'im. Others facing Stevedore mutter agreement.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY,FATHER BARRY AND EDIE
dialogues.text: Terry's eyes flutter as they bathe his wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Father Barry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're waiting for him to walk in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that, Terry?  (as Terry fails to respond)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry, did you hear that?  (trying to penetrate Terry's batteredmind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost the battle but you have a chance to win  the war. All you gotta do is walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly coming to)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...walk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny Friendly is layin' odds that you won't get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in B.G., shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you guys! Friendly's voice acts as a prod on Terry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me on my feet. They make an effort to pick him up. He can barely stand. around unseeingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I on my feet...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on your feet. You can finish what you started. Blood oozing from his wounds, Terry sways, uncomprehendin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mutters through bloody lips)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can? Okay.  Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams at Father Barry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you trying to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the groggy Terry starts up the ramp, Edie reaches out Barry holds her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone. Take your hands off himВ—  Leave him alone. Staggering, moving painfully forward, Terry starts up the instinct is to help him but Father Barry, knowing the sta symbolic act, holds her back. Terry stumbles, but steadie moves forward as if driven on by Father Barry's will.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY APPROACHING PIER ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: As he staggers forward as if blinded, the longshoremen fo either side of him, awed by his courage, waiting to see i it. Terry keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting at pier entrance as Terry approaches. Shot out of Terry would see him through bloody haze.

dialogues.speaker: TERRY
dialogues.text: As the men who have formed a path for him watch intently, staggers up until he is face to face with the Stevedore. himself as if to say, "I'm ready. Let's go."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls officially)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All rightВ— let's go to work! As Terry goes past him into the pier, the men with a sens inevitability fall in behind him.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY FRIENDLY
dialogues.text: Hurrying forward in a last desperate effort to stop the m following Terry in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you guys goin'? Wait a minute! As they stream past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back! I'll be back! And I'll remember every last one of ya! He points at them accusingly. But they keep following Ter pier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Father Barry and Edie look on, Stevedore blows his whi to begin. Longshoremen by the hundreds march into the pier behind Terry like a c army. In the B.G. a frenzied Johnny Friendly is still scr be back! I'll be back!" The threat, real as it is, is los forward progress of Terry and the ragtail army of dock wo leads.
